text: ANOTHER VERY IMPACTFUL DAY FOR DELTA. THE AFPJX5 RATES APPEARED TO BE APPROPRIATE IN THE INITIAL RUN BUT DID NOT PREVENT GROUND STOPS FOR NORTHBOUND FLIGHTS OUT OF ZMA. GETTING FLIGHTS OUT OF FLORIDA TO THE NORTH WAS VERY CHALLENGING.
label: negative

text: QUIET EVENING SHIFT, THANKS FOR YOUR HELP TODAY.
label: positive

text: THANKS FOR YOUR HELP TODAY!
label: positive

text: BASED ON THE EXTENT OF THE TSTM COVERAGE IN THE NE, THE IMPACT TO THE ROUTES OUT OF THE N90 AIRPORTS SEEMED EXCESSIVE, BUT THE STAFFING SHORTAGE MAY HAVE HAD A BIGGER IMPACT TONIGHT. PHL DID AN OUTSTANDING JOB TONIGHT WITH ALL OF OUR MAINLINE AND REGIONAL FLIGHTS. THANK YOU PHL ATC FOLKS!
label: positive

text: GIVEN THE WEATHER AND STAFFING CONSTRAINTS, ALL WENT REASONABLY WELL TODAY.
label: positive

text: DISAPPOINTED AT THE LACK OF COLLABORATION REFERENCE THE ATL WEATHER EVENT. GS INITIATED WITH NO WEATHER WITHIN 25NM OF THE AIRPORT AND 44 AIRCRAFT IN THE AIR AT A 80 RATE. ONLY ONE FIX WITH ARRIVAL WEATHER OTHERS WERE RUNNING SINGLE STREAM (PER ZTL) AT WHAT I BELIEVE IS AN 80 RATE. GS EXTENDED DUE TO EMERGENCY INBOUND AIRCRAFT AND FEAR OF POSSIBLE LOSS OF RUNWAY .. THE EMERGENCY WAS LANDING ON THE DEPARTURE RUNWAY AND SHOULD HAVE HAD NO IMPACT TO THE LANDING OPERATION AS IT WAS EXPECTED TO TAXI TO THE GATE AFTER LANDING, WE WOULD HAVE PREFERRED THE GS BEEN CANCELLED PRIOR TO THAT EVENT.
label: negative

text: OVERALL, IT WAS A GOOD DAY. DURING THE FCAJXE DISCUSSION, A REQUEST TO RAISE THE FLOOR FROM FL160 TO FL180 WAS ASKED AND GRANTED, WE THANK YOU FOR THAT. IN ADDITION, WE ASKED THE QUESTION OF HOW THE RATES FOR THE AFP WERE DETERMINED. TODAY THE RATES SEEMED MORE IMPACTFUL THAN DAYS PAST (20/20/20/20/20/20/30/40/50), DRIVING AVERAGE DELAYS OF 150 MINS. WE NEVER GOT A CLEAR ANSWER ON HOW THE PROGRAM RATES ARE DETERMINED. AGAIN THANKS FOR YOUR HELP TODAY.
label: positive

text: TRYING TO FIGURE OUT WHY ASA221 JFKSEA WAS LEFT ON TAXIWAY FOR SO LONG. HAD TO RETURN TO GATE WHILE OTHER WEST BOUND FLIGHTS THAT ALL PUSHED AROUND THE SAME TIME OR EVEN LATER WERE ABLE TO DEPART (ASA657 JBU263 DAL338 AAL2305). THIS SEEMS TO HAPPEN TO ASA221 TOO OFTEN - THEY GET SENT TO THE SOUTH SIDE OF FIELD BY RWY 13R AND SEEMS LIKE THEY GET FORGOTTEN ABOUT. I KNOW THEY AREN'T ACTUALLY FORGOTTEN BUT IT'S VERY FRUSTRATING TO WATCH THEM SITTING THERE WHILE OTHERS GOING WESTBOUND (AND SOME WHO'VE PUSHED AFTER ASA221) ARE ALLOWED TO LINE UP & DEPART.
label: negative

text: WE TOOK UNEXPECTED LONG DEPARTURE DELAYS OUT OF TPA FROM 1230-1500Z WITH UAL 2141 TPA DEN :131 MINUTES TO GET AIRBORNE. UAL 407 TPA ORD :84 MINUTES TO GET AIRBORNE. UAL 1493 TPA IAH :106 MINUTES TO GET AIRBORNE. WE ALSO TOOK LESSER DELAYS OUT OF RSW, FLL AND MIA. WE SUSPECT THAT THE REROUTES THAT PUSHED MORE TRAFFIC OVER THE WESTERN SIDE OF FLORIDA MAY HAVE BEEN A SIGNIFICANT CONTRIBUTOR TO THE DELAY. IF DEPARTURE DELAYS WILL EXCEED 45-60 MINUTES WITH NO WX IN THE TERMINAL AREA WE NEED MORE WARNING SO THAT WE CAN PLAN APPROPRIATELY.
label: negative

text: PLEASE NOTE, THE COMMENTS THAT FOLLOW ARE INTENDED FOR PM SHIFT AUGUST 5TH ,.... NO DOUBLT A DIFFICULT DAY FOR ALL. THE SHIFT WAS BUSY, AS WAS EXPECTED. OBSERVATION, SOME GDP REVISIONS NEEDED 2 OR MORE HOURS WORTH OF AIRBORNE RATES USED TO STEM THE FLOW. THAT LIKELY INDICATED WE UNDERESTIMSTED EITHER THE WEATHER IMPACT, THE STAFFING IMPACT, OR A COMBINATION OF BOTH, AS WAS THE CASE WITH ZNY TONIGHT. ADDITIONALLY, CONSIDERING THE SHORT DURATION OF THE IAD AND DEN GDP-S, WE WONDER IF THEY WERE ACTUALLY NECESSARY. BOTH WERE PRECEDED BY GROUND STOPS, WHICH MAY HAVE LED TO THE GDP CONSIDERATIONS, BUT IN HINDSIGHT, THEY MAY HAVE RECOVERED JUST AS WELL WITHOUT THE GDP-S. LASTLY, WE APPRECIATE THE PHL TRACONS EFFORTS TO KEEP THEIR TRAFFIC VOLUME MOVING, WHICH AVOIDED A GDP/GS.
label: neutral

text: ZHU - A BIG THANK YOU TO ALL THE HOUSTON FACILITIES FOR MANAGING THE SEVERE WEATHER IN AND AROUND THE IAH TERMINAL AND IN THE ENROUTE ENVIRONMENT. HOPEFULLY WE CAN KEEP IT GOING FOR THE LATE AFTERNOON AS WELL. SFO - ALSO GREAT WORK AT SFO BY THE FACILITIES WHEN WE SUDDENLY LOST VISUALS DURING THE BUSIEST HOUR OF THE DAY. WE EXPERIENCED MINIMAL IMPACT FROM THE LOSS OF CAPACITY AND SUFFERED NO DIVERSIONS.

text: CHALLENGING DAY, THANKS FOR YOUR HELP TODAY.

text: WE NOTED A NUMBER OF EXTENDED TAXIS TODAY FROM THE DC METRO AREA TO BOS RESULTING FROM THE ZNY STAFFING TRIGGER THIS EVENING. TWO FLIGHTS, JBU2454 AND JBU1354, BOTH DCA-BOS, DEPARTED WITHIN A SIMILAR TIME FRAME. JBU2454 PUSHED BACK AT 2117Z. AT 2154Z THE FLIGHT CREW OF JBU2454 NOTIFIED OUR DISPATCH TEAM THAT THEY HAD BEEN GIVEN A WHEELS UP TIME OF 2255Z. THIS WOULD HAVE RESULTED IN A 98MIN TAXI FOR THE FLIGHT, SO A REQUEST WAS POSTED TO THE TCA PAGE AT 2204Z TO SEE IF SOME RELIEF COULD BE PROVIDED. JBU1354 DCA-BOS PUSHED BACK AT 2145Z. AT 2217Z, JBU2454 NOTIFIED US THAT JBU1354 HAD BEEN PROVIDED WITH A BETTER WHEELS UP TIME THAN THEM ¿ THIS INFORMATION WAS ADDED AS AN EDIT TO THE TCA PAGE REQUEST THAT HAD NOT YET BEEN ADDRESSED. COMMAND CENTER TCA ADVISED IN THE REQUEST FOLLOWING A PHONE CONVERSATION THAT ZDC WOULD TRY TO SWAP THE TIMES FOR THE FLIGHTS. JBU1354 DEPARTED AT 2235Z MAKING A 50MIN TAXI, WHILE JBU2454 DEPARTED AT 2248Z MAKING A 91MIN TAXI. WE APPRECIATE THE ATTEMPTED COORDINATION TO TRY AND RECTIFY THE ISSUE, BUT THIS ISSUE OVERALL SEEMED AVOIDABLE AND THE INEQUITABLE SURFACE DELAY PUT UNDUE DISCOMFORT ON OUR PASSENGERS AND STRAIN TO OUR FLIGHT CREW SCHEDULES.
label: negative

text: DFW - WE APPRECIATE THE TIMELY AND QUICK ACTION REGARDING THE FUEL FARM ISSUE AND THE COORDINATION TO RELEASE FLIGHTS THAT COULD FUEL THROUGH THE AIRPORT. EWR - GOOD COLLABORATION ON GDP PARAMETERS ON WHAT WILL BE A TOUGH LATE AFTERNOON/EVENING OPERATION.
label: positive

text: CONTROVERSY AROUND THE ISSUANCE AND TIMING OF THE GDPS/AFPS, BUT OVERALL THE SCENARIO PLAYED OUT FAIRLY WELL. THE KEY WAS TO KEEP THE WATRS ROUTES OPEN AND AVAILABLE AS ROUTE OUTS, WHILE KEEPING THE DEPARTURES FLOWING. WOULD BE INTERESTING TO REPLAY SANS GDPS TO TEST THE FEASIBILITY. GENERALLY LATE START OF WEATHER DEVELOPMENT ALSO PROVED VALUABLE BUT WILL BE LESS LIKELY AS SUMMER APPROACHES. BELIEVE THE ID1 AND DC7 RATES WERE STEPPED DOWN TOO QUICKLY AND TOO FAR, AND WE LOST CAPACITY ON THOSE SECTORS. CAN ALWAYS REVISE DOWN LATER.
label: Neutral

THE PLAYBOOK WAS NEVER ISSUED, HOWEVER ALL FLIGHTS IN THE SE WERE REROUTED BACK ON THIS PLAYBOOK IN-FLIGHT. WOULD APPRECIATE MORE UNDERSTANDING ON THIS ONE. THANKS TO THE COMMAND CENTER FOR HELP WITH CRITICAL FLIGHTS. THANKS TO ZFW AS WELL FOR CQY HELP!

text: A ROUGH NIGHT FOR US IN DEN WITH THUNDERSTORM IMPACTS AND DIVERSIONS. THE DEN FACILITIES AND DCC WERE HELPFUL WITH THE STRATEGY, THE WEATHER HIT AT THE WORST POSSIBLE TIME WITH MOST OF THE VOLUME AIRBORNE.
label: negative

text: NO ISSUES AND THANKS FOR YOUR HELP TODAY.
label: positive

text: "CHALLENGING DAY SHIFT FOR OUR DAL OPERATION. WE WERE CHALLENGED WITH SOME TSRA EARLIER THAN FORECAST, BUT THE FACILITIES (ZFW, D10, DAL TWR) WERE ALL HANDLING IT WELL AND TRAFFIC WAS MOVING AT A GOOD PACE. COMMUNICATION WAS GOOD ON THE TEXAS HOTLINE AND WE APPRECIATED RAPID ATTEMPTS TO RE-OPEN DEPARTURE GATES WITH PATHFINDERS AND TIMELY SWAPS TO OTHER GATES. THE PROBLEM STARTED AROUND 1400Z OR SO WHEN DAL DEPARTURES GOT SLOWED DOWN TO A NEAR DEPARTURE STOP. THE DAL SURFACE STARTED BACKING UP. INITIALLY IT WAS JUST SOUTH GATE DEPARTURES, BUT EVEN AS THE SOUTH GATE RE-OPENED WE WERE NOT SEEING ANY DEPARTURES OFF OF DAL. AS THE SURFACE STARTED TO BACK UP, WE STARTED TO COMMUNICATE WITH ZFW AND D10 ABOUT GETTING SOME FLIGHTS OVER 60 MINUTES MOVING AND WE WERE ABLE TO GET TWO OF THOSE FLIGHTS AIRBORNE. SOON AFTER, DAL DEPARTURES SLOWED TO CRAWL WHILE DFW FLIGHTS WERE FLOWING AT A GOOD RATE. BY 1550Z, DAL WAS BACKED UP WITH SEVERAL FLIGHT GOING +60. AFTER ANOTHER ROUND OF PHONE CALLS AROUND 1600Z, WE WERE INFORMED THAT DFW WAS GETTING FAVORED AS ""THE DELAY NUMBERS SHOWED DFW AT 75 MINS AND DAL AT 45 MINS."" AT THAT TIME, WE HAD MULTIPLE FLIGHTS OVER 90 MINUTES, SEVERAL FLIGHTS OVER 60 MINUTES, AND AT LEAST A DOZEN MORE THAN 45 MINUTES. DAL WAS BECOMING GRID LOCKED BUT THE ""DELAY NUMBERS"" WERE NOT EVEN CLOSE TO CORRECT (WE WERE MONITORING DFW SURFACE). IT TOOK SEVERAL CALLS TO GET THIS POINT ACROSS AND EVEN A SWA ONLY GS TO BE ISSUED IN ORDER TO GET SOME KIND OF DEPARTURE RATE AT DAL. AS I WRITE THIS AT 1742Z, WE HAVE NOT FULLY RECOVERED BUT ARE FINALLY DOWN TO A COUPLE OF FLIGHTS 45 MIN +. THE DELAY NUMBERS AND THEIR APPARENT INACCURACY DROVE DAL TO A NEAR DEPARTURE STOP AND GRIDLOCK TO FAVOR ANOTHER FACILITY. THAT BEING SAID, WE REALLY APPRECIATE THE EFFORTS OF ZFW, D10 AND DAL TOWER THROUGHOUT THE EVENT. ONCE WE WERE ABLE TO ESTABLISH THAT WE HAD AN ISSUE AT DAL, THE FACILITIES WERE ABLE TO GET DAL FLIGHTS MOVING AND THE DELAY NUMBERS MOVING IN A POSITIVE DIRECTION. IN THE FUTURE, IT WOULD BE NICE TO FIND WAYS TO COMMUNICATE TIMELY AND ACCURATE DATA SO THAT WE CAN AVOID GETTING PUSHED TO THE BRINK OF GRIDLOCK AND PREVENT IT FROM HAPPENING IN THE FIRST PLACE."
label: Neutral

text: CONCERNING THE JX7 AIRSPACE FLOW PROGRAM (AFP), JETBLUE FULLY RECOGNIZED THE NEED FOR THE INITIATIVE GIVEN THE VOLUME JACKSONVILLE CENTER WAS FACING. THE 15Z HOUR OVER 300 FLIGHTS, AND SEVERAL HOURS THEREAFTER OVER THE 200 FLIGHT THRESHOLD, THOSE WERE IMMENSE THROUGHPUT CONCERNS EVEN WITHOUT WEATHER AND/OR STAFFING TRIGGERS. GIVEN THE STATE OF AIRLINES ABILITY TO RUN ELEVATED HOLIDAY SCHEDULES, WE¿D APPRECIATE GREATER CONSIDERATION OF ACTUAL THROUGHPUT COMPARED TO PLANNED THROUGHPUT GIVEN THE HIGH NUMBER OF CANCELLATION, AS WELL AS ROUTE-OUT OPTIONS, WHICH HELPED MITIGATE THE THROUGHPUT CONCERNS. BY PLANNING FOR OVER-DELIVERY OF THROUGHPUT WE STILL HAVE THE OPTION OF REVISING THE AFPS DOWN TO FURTHER REDUCE CAPACITY IF THE DEMAND TURNS OUT TO BE ACTUAL. THANKS AGAIN FOR THE HELP FROM TCA DURING THE OIS/ADVISORY DOWN PERIOD, THAT WAS EXCEPTIONAL WORK.
label: positive

text: RQD ROUTES WERE GENERALLY FAIR TO ADDRESS VOLUME CONSTRAINTS. JX7 RATES WERE AGAIN LOWER THAN EXPECTED, ESPECIALLY GIVEN THE LOWER VOLUME OF SCHEDULED CARRIER FLYING DUE TO CANCELLATIONS. PBI GDP WAS ISSUED TO LATE, DRIVING DELAY UP SIGNIFICANTLY FOR SCHEDULED CARRIERS. EARLIER ISSUANCE WILL STILL CONTROL TRAFFIC EFFECTIVELY WITHOUT OVER-PENALIZING SCHEDULED CARRIER AND SOME LEVEL OF POP-UP FACTOR SHOULD SUFFICE FOR THOSE LATE FILERS THAT BECOME KNOWN TO THE SYSTEM, WHICH ARE THE PRIMARY DRIVER OF THE NEED FOR THE PBI TMI.
